result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Manuel Escalera Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment. Huber for work and treatment.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Not allowed to DJ unless approved by agent. Participate in AODA counseling. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Comply with family court order. Pay the balance of ZCI fees. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Do not go into any bars or clubs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Corine 1:40
Preliminary hearing on August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   No contact with the co-defendant.

Defendant Juan Manuel Escalera in court with attorney David Saldana.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: Warrant vacated.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Deft learned of warrant and contacted Atty Saldana to appear ASAP - RWIN 8/15/14 1:30 PM.
